title: rustdoc: Add more test coverage

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: A-testsuite
labels.description: Area: The testsuite used to check the correctness of rustc

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
### Summary

Currently, [rustdoc](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/tree/master/src/librustdoc) doesn't have much test coverage, but it _does_ have a lot of edge cases. We would like to have more test coverage, so we can improve the code with less risk of introducing bugs.

It's even helpful to add tests for incorrect behavior since it will help us find, fix, and test the fixes for bugs.

### What to test

- Behavior of re-exports (e.g., `pub use self::foo::bar`) and inlining (some re-exports are rendered as re-exports, while others have their docs copied as if the re-export is the definition)
- Trait implementations, including normal impls, blanket impls (e.g., `impl<T> MyTrait for &T`), and auto impls (like `Sized`, `Send`, and `Sync`)
- Notable traits popup (appears as an `(i)` next to return types); it has some bugs currently that would be good to fix.

### How to test

Here is the documentation for rustdoc's main tests (the tests in `src/test/rustdoc`):

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/49d42325d0888a27ed50bf918d378fbf7f41a348/src/etc/htmldocck.py#L28-L100

You may also want to look at some existing tests in `src/test/rustdoc`.

Please note that you **do _not_ need to check that rustdoc's behavior is correct**. We will check during code review, and as mentioned earlier, tests for incorrect behavior can be helpful too.

**If you have any questions or get stuck, please ask here or [on Zulip in `#rustdoc`](https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/266220-rustdoc)!**
